intro: Euryops brevipapposus, commonly known as the dwarf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with small, narrow leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are daisy-like, consisting of a central disc surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms throughout the growing season. Euryops brevipapposus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
